channel.title: Camtasia studios... ( legit copy... )
channel.description:
I can't seem to figure out why but I am unable to record fullscreen Batman:Arkham Origins. I have followed all tutorials on youtube.... have had camtasia support staff attempt to help....and etc. This ir ridiculous. Any suggestions as to what could be the problem?
I run Windows 8.1 with 16GB memory/a r9 290x/8350 vishera so spec wise it's absolutely not a problem

item.title: Camtasia studios... ( legit copy... )
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Wow I use OBS to stream and never even considered just using it to record. Hows the filesize and such?

Read full topic

item.title: Camtasia studios... ( legit copy... )
item.dc:creator: @Tree Tree
item.description:
@Tree wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:7, topic:541763”][quote author=Tree link=topic=660629.msg4417547#msg4417547 date=1396661105]
https://obsproject.com/
Save output locally.
[/quote]this looks like a great program and I have it saving a file locally yet it is still just showing a black screen. I did read something about AMD machines on tehir forums have issues with their software. Cause we have two gpu adapters or something?[/quote]

Create a new scene and then in the area next to that, add a monitor display. It requires a little setting up and playing around with but it should work.

Read full topic

item.title: Camtasia studios... ( legit copy... )
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:13, topic:541763”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=660629.msg4417679#msg4417679 date=1396738969]
Camtasia has a lot of difficulty with fullscreen. It can’t record League, Dark Souls, Starbound, Terraria, etc in fullscreen (but it can do borderless). My hypothesis is that it doesn’t know how to adjust to different display modes, but who knows. I’m not really sure how to fix it other than doing borderless
[/quote]that’s pretty much what techsmith told me as well I was hoping somebody here knew how to tweak a file or part of the program or something but I guess not

I just find it strange I can use pirated software and record it but can’t with camtasia[/quote]
Generally I don’t think camtasia is designed for full screen games in particular, it seems to market itself as more of business tool, with the annotations and their general design.

I would just stick to fraps personally, does everything you need capture wise.

Read full topic

My hypothesis is that it doesn’t know how to adjust to different display modes, but who knows. I’m not really sure how to fix it other than doing borderless[/quote]that’s pretty much what techsmith told me as well I was hoping somebody here knew how to tweak a file or part of the program or something but I guess not

item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

Camtasia has a lot of difficulty with fullscreen. It can’t record League, Dark Souls, Starbound, Terraria, etc in fullscreen (but it can do borderless). My hypothesis is that it doesn’t know how to adjust to different display modes, but who knows. I’m not really sure how to fix it other than doing borderless

item.title: Camtasia studios... ( legit copy... )
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:10, topic:541763”]It’s not AMD that’s the issue…?[/quote]then what is

I am able to record with camtasia but I can’t record fullscreen on that particular game. There are some games I can do recording with it and some others I can’t Just doesn’t make sense to me.

Read full topic
